questions.text:
Connections

You can add your db2 and netezza database connections here

Webhooks

Use webhooks when jobs are done or to report errors. Or just them for any callback in your job.

Tags

Add tags that you can use for job searches and classification

Templates

Use templates for reusable code. You can use them just as a copy and continue to work or as a permenant shared template

Code Snipptes

Snippets are pieces of code that can be used within your code

Organizations

View organizations you belong to.

Profiles

View the users in your organization and their profile.

Form refresh

Refreshes all forms

questions.text:
Parameters

You can use various options in your parameters. Below we try to detail them

questions.value:
# Document Describes the usuage of the parameters section in your job. It has following sections # Mail # Slack # Config Maps # Connections # Value Pairs # Config Overwrite --- # Mail (Pipelines and Jobs) # Applies to pipelines and jobs, subject or html are optional mail: subject: Your access Manager report html: "
Please find enclosed your↵ list of access users
" --- # API Key (Pipelines and Jobs) # You can use your own api key to post to your prefered channel # Add your api key in the webhook section and reference it with the selector # Select the status you would like to have posted to slack slack: disabled: true webhook: slackbizops status: - Failed - Submitted --- # Config Maps (Jobs) # You can use the values of configmaps in your job # Create them in the config map section in settings # Reference them with the selector configmaps: - globals - apiserver - adminmgr using in your code: | You can use the variables as follows: 1 directly as key replacement :adminmgr_x-api-key 2 or via access to the object like adminmgr['x-api-key'] --- # Connections (Jobs) # Connections can be used as follows connections: - db2wh_etl - ssabl - progresql using in your code: | You can use the variables as follows: 1 directly as key replacement :db2wh_etl_username 2 or via access to the object like db2wh_etl['username'] --- # Value Pairs (jobs) # Value pairs are simple keyword replacements # When using in sql make sure they are appropriately quotes and or enclosed pl_glaccounts: ( '3572100', '3620300', '3620301', '3620302', '3620305', '3620600', '3620306', '3620307' ) div: (2,3,4) database: cloud0.revenue about: This is a test using in your code: | You can use the variables as follows sql: select * from :database where code in pl_glaccounts python: print(':about!') --- # Config Overwrite (Pipelines) # In some cases you might want to overwrite the default config config: source: connection: db2wh_etl target: connection: db2wh_prod stmt: connection: db2wh_prod using in your code: | The settins above will overwrite the source and target in a transfer job It will overwrite the connection in a statement job
